title: May Day Strong: South Bay LA
description: Organized by Indivisible South Bay Los Angeles, this event is a public demonstration advocating for labor rights, fair wages, union protection, and safety for families. It responds to perceived attacks on unions and immigrant families, aiming to build community power.
raw_text:
Sat
3
MAY
May Day Strong: South Bay LA
by Indivisible South Bay Los Angeles
Public event  Movements and politics  may day  protest  workers  unions  labor

About this event
Across the country‚Äîfrom fruit fields in California to classrooms in Chicago, from kitchens in Queens to loading docks in Atlanta‚Äîworking people are rising up. We are demanding a country that puts our families over their fortunes‚Äîpublic schools over private profits, healthcare over hedge funds, housing over homelessness.

Musk, Trump and their fellow profiteers are trying to create a race to the bottom‚Äîon wages, on benefits, on dignity itself. They want to erase labor rights, break our unions, and silence immigrant voices.

May Day 2025 we are fighting back. Organizing for a world where every family has housing, healthcare, fair wages, union protection, and safety‚Äîregardless of race, zip code, or immigration status.

They're defunding our schools, privatizing public services, attacking unions, and targeting immigrant families with fear and violence. This is a war on working people, and we will not stand down. This day of action is just the beginning. We're organizing not just for one day, but to build power in every neighborhood, on every shop floor, and in every school.
